Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 04:08AM summersoff wrote: I go tomorrow for stereotactic biopsy.  Scared, but reading these posts has been a comfort.  Lost my mom at age 54 (her age) to ovarian cancer and lost dad to prostate cancer (he was 58).  I'm only 42 and have been having mammos. since age 30.  We now have digital mammog. and at this year's screening, they found microcalcifications.  The doctor showed me the view and they looked linear.  Is that good or bad?  This has all happened quickly (over the past 2 weeks) so I'm thankful and lucky to not have to wait as long as some of you seem to have had to do.  I should get results 48 hours after biopsy.  I've had 2 needle biopsies that came back b9 in the past, but this one seems to be a bigger deal.  I'm aware of the 80% chance blah blah blah, but I also have very dense breasts.  I'm preparing my mind for the worst and hoping for the best.  I am of the opinion that if anything comes back "sketchy" I will want to skip all the wait and see crap and radiation and go straight for mastectomy.  Is that too radical?  Too much scary stuff and too close to home having lost both parents to cancer.   I'd love to hear comments.
